turn.0: ELI5: What are arrays in programming?
turn.1: > easier for declaring variables when making long code  That is one surefire way to get more experienced programmers to hate you.
turn.3: It is good practice to have variable names with clear naming that accurately describes what they are for. What you're suggesting results in variables with absolutely no name whatsoever. (array[0], array[1], array[2] are hardly descriptive).  Moreover, good programming means dissecting your problem into small easily managed chunks. So small, clear functions or objects. If you have a lot of variables in these, you are doing it wrong.  https://www.amazon.com/Clean-Code-Handbook-Software-Craftsmanship/dp/0132350882
turn.4: okay. i have started using arrays now
turn.5: Use arrays when you need to hold 'a list of things' or model a table of data.
